name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Case of the Tin Soldier
description: Inspector Smythe from Scotland Yard has informed Watson and me of the murder of General Armstead, a Tontine ticket holder. Something about this case intrigues me. Perhaps it Ã­s that the General was about to publish a scintillating addendum to his infamous book on treasure.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 and up Processor: 2.33ghz or better Memory: 512 MB RAM

reviews.review_text: Another weak case dragging down a good system. Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective is a sweet system for playing short one-shot murder mystery games but just like The Case of the Mystified Murderess, the case here doesn't do the system justice.  There's not particularly any mystery to this case. No intuitive leaps needed. Just follow every lead to its conclusion and the culprit will all but be dropped into your hands by the end. It feels less like a mystery and more like a police procedural. The score system is pretty uncharitable too, but even less so in a case whose 'challenge' is in presenting a lot of apparently valid starting points and asking you to brute-force your way through until you find the thread that, when tugged upon, unravels everything else.
